meanings.definition: To make a series of slight, sharp snapping noises
meanings.sent1: The fire crackles in the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: I love the sound when bacon crackles in the pan.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn crackles happily in the microwave.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room crackles like electricity.
meanings.sent5: The dry leaves crackle under my feet as I walk.

meanings.definition: A series of slight, sharp snapping noises
meanings.sent1: The crackles of the campfire were soothing.
meanings.sent2: The crackles of the old vinyl record added to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The crackles of the cereal in the bowl made me smile.
meanings.sent4: The crackles of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The crackles of the ice breaking sounded like music.

meanings.sent1: The children's laughter crackles with joy.
meanings.sent3: The party crackles with excitement and music.
meanings.sent4: His speech crackles with passion and conviction.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere crackles with anticipation before the big game.
